                     byte[] jobData)
Creates a GearmanJob

Parameters:
function - The name of the gearman function that can execute this job
jobData - The data sent to the gearman function to be processed.

GearmanJob

protected GearmanJob(java.lang.String function,
                     byte[] jobData,
                     GearmanJob.Priority priority)
Creates a GearmanJob

Parameters:
function - The name of the gearman function that can execute this job
jobData - The data sent to the gearman function to be processed.
priority - Specifies the jobs priority level
Method Detail

getJobHandle

public final ByteArray getJobHandle()
Retrieves the job handle if one is available. While in the WORKING state, the job handle is available by both on the client and worker sides.

Returns:
The job handle if one is available. If not, null is returned

isConnected

public final boolean isConnected()
Tests if there is a connection to the job server. This information may be useful to a GearmanFunction that performs long running jobs. If the connection to the server has been lost, it may be better to abandon the execution and free up the thread resource. This value can only be true in the WORKING state.

Returns:
true if and only if there is a live connection to the job server.

getJobPriority

protected final GearmanJob.Priority getJobPriority()
Returns this job's priority. When a job is pulled from the server's job queue depends on both the order it was added and the job's priory. Jobs with a higher priority are polled before those with a lower priority

This method is only accessible on the client side.

Returns:
The job's priority level.

getJobState

public final GearmanJob.State getJobState()
Returns the job's current state. The available states are as follows:
* NEW: The job has been created. Only in this state can jobs be submitted to clients
* SUBMITTED: The job has been submitted to a client, but not to a job server
* WORKING: The job has been submitted to a job server. A GearmanFunction will receive the job in this state. Only in this state will callback methods be called by a remote worker
* COMPLETE: The job has finished execution, and the result of the execution is available

Returns:
The job's current state

callbackData

public abstract void callbackData(byte[] data)
The data callback channel.

When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information to the client while the job is executing

Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.

Parameters:
data - Information to send on the data callback channel

callbackWarning

public abstract void callbackWarning(byte[] warning)
The warning callback channel. This is just like the data callback channel, but its purpose is to send warning information.

When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information to the client while the job is executing

Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.

Parameters:
data - Information to send on the data callback channel

getFunctionName

public final java.lang.String getFunctionName()
Returns the name of the gearman function that can execute this job

Returns:
The name of the gearman function that can execute this job

getJobData

public final byte[] getJobData()

onComplete

protected abstract void onComplete(GearmanJobResult result)
The onComplete method is triggered when the GearmanJobResult becomes available.

Parameters:
result - The result from executing this GearmanJob

callbackStatus

public abstract void callbackStatus(long numerator,
                                    long denominator)
Updates the client of the job progress.

When the GearmanFunction receives a GearmanJob, this method can used to send information about the jobs progress back to the client.

Client Side: Override this method to define how information received on this callback channel should be handled. If this method is not overwritten, the information will be dropped.

Worker Side: This method will throw a IllegalStateException if the job has completed. Only while the job is executing can the callback methods be used.

Parameters:
numerator - A number typically specifying the numerator in the fraction work that's completed
denominator - A number typically specifying the denominator in the fraction work that's completed

isComplete

public final boolean isComplete()
Tests if this job is completed.

Returns:
returns true if this job is in the COMPLETED state

getGearmanJobResult

public final GearmanJobResult getGearmanJobResult()
Attempts to return the result. If the result is not yet available, null is returned.

Returns:
The result if available. null is returned if the result is not available.

getStatus

public final void getStatus(GearmanJob.JobStatusCallbackHandler callback)
